intro: Cyclostemon palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan cyclostemon, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glossy leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in lowland rainforests and is adapted to humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
